pullrequest.title: [A-2] Add  gpu ray sensor to ign-gazebo

content.raw:
> I would like to test that the messages are published properly

Yeah it would be great to at least get some visual confirmation that the sensor data is correct. Some options are:

1. Port Gazebo's `rendering::GpuLaser` to `ign-rendering`. That may be a good use for a plugin? Probably too much work for the moment.
1. Port Gazebo's `gui::LaserView` to `ign-gui`. That will require a complete rewrite - too much work for the moment.
1. Use [ros1_ign_bridge](https://github.com/osrf/ros1_ign_bridge) to forward laser scans to ROS and view them on RViz: probably the path of least friction at the moment, and will be good for us to start getting used to the bridge.

What do you think?
content.html:
I would like to test that the messages are published properly

Yeah it would be great to at least get some visual confirmation that the sensor data is correct. Some options are:

  1. Port Gazebo's rendering::GpuLaser to ign-rendering. That may be a good use for a plugin? Probably too much work for the moment.
  2. Port Gazebo's gui::LaserView to ign-gui. That will require a complete rewrite - too much work for the moment.
  3. Use ros1_ign_bridge to forward laser scans to ROS and view them on RViz: probably the path of least friction at the moment, and will be good for us to start getting used to the bridge.

What do you think?

pullrequest.title: [A-2] Add  gpu ray sensor to ign-gazebo

content.raw: I like the idea of being able to visualize Gazebo data through ROS, since we also should be able to see Depth camera, IMU and other sensors and focus on GUI plugins later. If that is ok with you I can do that for this and the next sensors.
content.html: I like the idea of being able to visualize Gazebo data through ROS, since we also should be able to see Depth camera, IMU and other sensors and focus on GUI plugins later. If that is ok with you I can do that for this and the next sensors.

pullrequest.title: [A-2] Add  gpu ray sensor to ign-gazebo

content.raw: Please, feel free to visually test this using the ROS bridge. If you get it to work, it would be nice to create a basic step-by-step tutorial in the `tutorials` folder just so others know how to set it up too. But note that this is low priority, so I wouldn't put too much time into it if it's not straight forward.
content.html: Please, feel free to visually test this using the ROS bridge. If you get it to work, it would be nice to create a basic step-by-step tutorial in the tutorials folder just so others know how to set it up too. But note that this is low priority, so I wouldn't put too much time into it if it's not straight forward.

pullrequest.title: [A-2] Add  gpu ray sensor to ign-gazebo

content.raw: The reason that the gpu lidar sensor in the integration test is producing `inf` is that the sensor pose is being updated here and also in ign-sensors. We should probably [remove those SetWorld\* calls](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-sensors/src/44478d338c57678adae77f61139ffabdde3df6d8/src/GpuLidarSensor.cc#lines-185) in GpuLidarSensor.cc
content.html: The reason that the gpu lidar sensor in the integration test is producing inf is that the sensor pose is being updated here and also in ign-sensors. We should probably remove those SetWorld* calls in GpuLidarSensor.cc
